scenario:
The S&P 500 is dominated by five companies, representing 28.8% of the index's value, with a combined market cap of $14.9 trillion. These companies are Apple, Nvidia, Microsoft, Alphabet, and Amazon. They have been driving the index's performance, with a 61% average gain in the past year, contributing to the S&P 500's 25% return in 2024. The S&P 500 Equal Weight index, which assigns equal weight to all stocks, returned only 10% in the same period.

These five companies are heavily investing in artificial intelligence (AI), with forecasted spending of hundreds of billions of dollars this year. Apple has launched its Apple Intelligence software, which includes AI-powered writing tools and a Siri upgrade. Nvidia is shipping its new Blackwell GB200 GPUs, which offer a significant leap in performance for AI development. Microsoft has invested $10 billion in OpenAI and launched its Copilot AI virtual assistant. Alphabet has developed its Gemini AI models and chatbot, and Amazon is integrating AI into its customer experience and cloud services.

The five companies have significant market share in the S&P 500, with Apple at 7.6%, Nvidia at 6.6%, Microsoft at 6.3%, Alphabet at 4.1%, and Amazon at 4.1%. They are expected to continue driving the index's performance and may become even more influential in the future. Apple, Nvidia, and Microsoft are expected to generate significant revenue growth, with Nvidia on track to generate a record $128.6 billion in total revenue in fiscal 2025. Amazon's AI revenue within its cloud services business is growing three times faster than the cloud business did at the same stage of its lifecycle.
